page.title: 15FARMING IN PONTESBURY.
page.content:
All the farms in the area are productive and efficient, ranging from 17 acres up to 1100 acres. Stock on these farms varies greatly but the majority of systems are intensive. One farm has 800 pigs, 8 cattle, 15 sheep, 3 acres of grass and 10 acres of barley. The largest farm has 1100 acres which consists of: 200 grass, 650 cereal, 50 rape and 200 sugar beet. Their stock consists of seasonal grazing animals, 160 beef cattle and 200 sheep. Occasionally they rear up to 3000 turkeys. On the dairy farms the herd numbers vary from 35 - 100 animals - British Friesian - and these are kept on as little as one acre of grassland per animal.
None of the farms had a wide variety of stock or crops but all tended to specialise on one or two systems.
